intro: Hibbertia abyssus, commonly known as the deep abyss hibbertia, is a rare and striking flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant orange to red flowers, which bloom in spring. The plant has a scrambling growth habit with woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in sandy soils and is often found in coastal heathlands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
